{{book |title=Lembas Extra 2016
Tolkien Among Scholars | image = Lembas Extra 2019.jpg |editor=[[Renée Vink]] |illustrator=Lúthien Dulk (cover art) |publisher=[[Unquendor]] |date=[[2019]] |format= |pages=152 |isbn=978-9492469168 }} '''''Lembas Extra 2019: The World Tolkien Built''''' is an issue of the journal ''[[Lembas (journal)|Lembas Extra]]''. The issue contains eight articles, the proceedings of the conference held at the University of Leiden. ==Contents== *"Introduction" by [[Renée Vink]] (pp. 5–6) *Thijs Porck: "Reshaping the Germanic Economy of Honour: Gift Giving in J.R.R. Tolkien's ''The Lord of the Rings''" (pp. 7–26) *Chiara Marchetti: "Tolkien's Medieval Monsters: Grendel, Gollum and Boromir" (pp. 27–47) *Berber Bossenbroek: "Ides Ælfscinu, Lúthien, and Judith: Towards a New Anglo-Saxon Analogue of J.R.R. Tolkien's Fiction" (pp. 49–57) *Lettie Dorst: "Fair, Fierce, Feigned: Gender Representations in ''The Lord of the Rings''" (pp. 59–78) *Renée Vink: "(Un)happily Ever After: The Many Woes of Tolkien's Lovers" (pp. 79–92) *Jan van Breda: "''The Statute of Finwë and Míriel'': Justice, Pity and the Irrevocable Free Will of the Dead" (pp. 93–110) *Hamish Williams: "Tolkien's Trolls: Intertextuality in 'Roast Mutton' and Monstrous Incarnations after ''The Hobbit''" (pp. 111–27) *[[Łukasz Neubauer]]: "'This local family game played in the country just round us': Some Remarks Concerning the Genesis of ''Farmer Giles of Ham''" (pp. 129–46) *"Biographies" (pp. 147–9) ==External links== *[https://www.unquendor.nl/?page_id=3958 Official page] *[https://www.tolkienshop.com/contents/en-uk/p9672.html Purchase page] {{title|journal}} [[Category:Lembas Extra]]
